result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle Tina Albert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Danielle Tina Albert is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Danielle Tina Albert was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Danielle Tina Albert was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine (Polk Co. Case #16CF86 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Restitution to be paid to Clerk of Court to pay to Victims.

Court reads-in and dismisses St. Croix County Case #16CM536 for purposes of restitution.
Court amends restitution in Polk County Case #16CF86 to $58.29 (including surcharges).

Court dismisses Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9 and 10.
Court dismisses Polk Co. Case 16CF86.
Court reads-in and dismisses Dunn Co. Case #16CF197 and Barron Co. Cases 16CF25 and 16CF52.
Court notes 51 days credit if revoked.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF552 (SEHR), 20CF466, 20CF699, 20CF708, 20CF728 and 20CM613 (PTC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Erica Ellenwood appears via video   DF ATTY:  T. Gregory Amann   DF:  Danielle Tina Albert appeared from jail. Agent Cormican appears via video. Case called at 2:15 p.m. Court notes 15CF522 is scheduled for a hearing on sentencing hearing on revocation. Remainder of files for a pre trial conference. Atty Amann states there is a resolution. Recites agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine in 20CF466, Ct 1 Retail Theft in 20CF699 and Ct's 1 Felony Bail Jumping & Ct 4 Retail Theft in 20CF708. DE sworn. ADA Ellenwood states there was not a preliminary hearing held in file 20CF708. Court informs DE of right to have a preliminary hearing. DE understands and waives right to preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court directs State to produce an information to mirror the complaint. Court would like sentencing recommendations on 15CF552. ADA Ellenwood gives sentencing recommendations. Agent Cormican in agreement with DE completing treatment court. Has not met with DE for a release plan. File will be transfered to Agent Anderson when in Treatment Atty Amann gives sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Will be residing with mom and then maybe going to Grace Place.   Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine in 20CF466, Ct 1 Retail Theft in 20CF699 and Ct's 1 Felony Bail Jumping & Ct 4 Retail Theft in 20CF708. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct's 2 & 3 in 20CF699, Ct 3 in 20CF708, 20CF728 in it's entirety, 20CM613 in it's entirety, Ct's 2 & 3 in 20CF466. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to appeal. State is in compliance with Victims Rights. Court notes 2 days jail credit in 20CF466 in the event of revocation. 121 days jail credit in 20CF699 in the event of revocation. 119 days jail credit in 20CF708 in the event of revocation.

Crt orders:
In Ct. 1 in 20CF466:
- S/W 3 years probation. Run concurrent to Ct. 1 in 20CF699, Ct's 1 & 4 in 20CF708. Contact Probation by 9 a.m. tomorrow 02-10-2021.
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
- Court costs of $268.00. Payable to DOC over the course of probation.
- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $250.00
- Successfully complete treatment court.
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Restitution in the amount of $14.00 payable to New Richmond Family Fresh
- No contact with the New Richmond Family Fresh
- Follow Family Court order in 20FA113
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Danielle Tina Albert appeared from jail.  Court called.  Set for Plea/Sentencing.  Includes Polk County Case 16CF86, Dunn County Case 16CF197,  Barron County Case 16CF52 & 16CF25, St. Croix County Case 16CT163, 16CF2902, 15CF552 & 15CF497.  State files an amended Information for 15CF552.  Ct. 6 in 15CF552 is Ct. 1 from Polk County Case 16CF86.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs the DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 & Ct. 6 in 15CF552.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 & Ct. 6. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2, Ct. 3, Ct. 4, Ct. 5, Ct. 7,  Ct. 8, Ct. 9 & Ct. 10 in 15CF552 & Crt dismisses 16CT163, 16CF290 & 15CF497 & Polk County Case 16CF86.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt. reads in and dismisses Dunn County Case 16CF197 subject to potential restitution, Barron County Case 16CF52 & 16CF25 are read in for restitution purposes and dismissed.   Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 & Ct. 6 in 15CF552 to run concurrent to each other
- W/S 3 years probation with conditions
- DE is sentenced to 120 days to begin today (10/14/16) in the St. Croix County Jail the last 30 days to be used by the St. Croix County Drug Court
- 51 days credit if revoked
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random testing
- AODA and participate in any recommended therapy or treatment
- Successfully complete drug court
- Restitution to Barron County in the amount of $471.31 to be paid through the DOC
- Restitution of $52 for a blood draw to St. Croix County to be paid through DOC
- 30 days to finalize restitution 
- Court costs of $536.00 and $500 for the DNA Surcharge to be paid through the DOC
- 20 days to appeal

INCLUDES 15CF497 and 15CF552

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Francis B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
